  "description": "DMOT Enterprises - Our client, a Manufacturing company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Qualification- HND/Degree in Purchasing and Supply or other Social Sciences.
	3 to 5 years of experience in similar role in a Manufacturing or FMCG setting
	Should have team spirit;
	Should be ready to work on Lagos Mainland.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly.&nbsp;

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;ayomaku@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Procurement Officer Job at DMOT Enterprises




        
    

        
        DMOT Enterprises - Our client, a Manufacturing company, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Qualification- HND/Degree in Purchasing and Supply or other Social Sciences.
	3 to 5 years of experience in similar role in a Manufacturing or FMCG setting
	Should have team spirit;
	Should be ready to work on Lagos Mainland.


Salary
N250,000 Monthly. 
     

            
    



Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: ayomaku@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Accountant",
  "description": "HTSF Global Nigeria Limited is an indigenous company dedicated to revolutionizing the Agriculture sector by leveraging technology and a strong commitment to service excellence. Founded on the vision of bridging the gap in accessing quality inputs, HTSF Global has established itself as a leader in the Nigerian Agricultural landscape. This is exemplified by its integrated farm operations and expansion into logistics and retail through innovation and dedication.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location:&nbsp;Ile Ife, Osun
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary


	As our Accountant, you will oversee daily financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and contribute to the company&rsquo;s financial strategy.
	You&rsquo;ll play a key role in managing accounting transactions, budgets, payroll, and accurate financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Handle accounts payable/receivable and bank reconciliations
	Oversee monthly payroll scheduling and salary disbursement for all staff
	Ensure compliance with statutory payments and filings (FIRS, PENCOM, ITF, NSITF, etc.)
	Prepare budgets, forecasts, and cash flow statements
	Support audits and liaise with external auditors
	Advise management on financial risks and opportunities
	Implement and maintain accounting systems and internal controls


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2&ndash;4 years of proven experience in a similar role
	Must have a Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, etc.)
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books) and MS Excel
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Integrity, discretion, and a detail-oriented mindset.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Opportunity for growth in a technology-driven organization
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV to:&nbsp;htsfarmshumanresources@gmail.com&nbsp;and copy:&nbsp;careers@htsfarms.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Accountant&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "HTSF Global Nigeria Ltd"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Osun",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    }

}



Accountant Job at HTSF Global Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        HTSF Global Nigeria Limited is an indigenous company dedicated to revolutionizing the Agriculture sector by leveraging technology and a strong commitment to service excellence. Founded on the vision of bridging the gap in accessing quality inputs, HTSF Global has established itself as a leader in the Nigerian Agricultural landscape. This is exemplified by its integrated farm operations and expansion into logistics and retail through innovation and dedication.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant
Job Location: Ile Ife, Osun
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Summary
     

            
    




	As our Accountant, you will oversee daily financial operations, ensure regulatory compliance, and contribute to the company’s financial strategy.
	You’ll play a key role in managing accounting transactions, budgets, payroll, and accurate financial reporting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate financial records and prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Handle accounts payable/receivable and bank reconciliations
	Oversee monthly payroll scheduling and salary disbursement for all staff
	Ensure compliance with statutory payments and filings (FIRS, PENCOM, ITF, NSITF, etc.)
	Prepare budgets, forecasts, and cash flow statements
	Support audits and liaise with external auditors
	Advise management on financial risks and opportunities
	Implement and maintain accounting systems and internal controls


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field.
	2–4 years of proven experience in a similar role
	Must have a Professional certification (ICAN, ACCA, etc.)
	Proficient in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books) and MS Excel
	Strong organizational and communication skills
	Integrity, discretion, and a detail-oriented mindset.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary
	Opportunity for growth in a technology-driven organization
	Supportive and collaborative work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their CV to: htsfarmshumanresources@gmail.com and copy: careers@htsfarms.ng using “Accountant” as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Center Manager",
  "description": "TeamAce Limited - Our client, a Dental Care Provider, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Center Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Center Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the dental clinic to ensure smooth workflow, excellent patient care, and compliance with regulatory standards.
	You will provide leadership, manage administrative and financial functions, and support staff to deliver high-quality service.


Responsibilities


	Oversee daily clinic operations to ensure efficient service delivery
	Manage staff schedules, performance, and patient flow for optimal care
	Monitor clinic finances, billing, and reporting to support business sustainability
	Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and maintain a professional patient experience.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field (Master&rsquo;s preferred)
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in healthcare administration, office management, or related role
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills
	Must reside on the Island (preferred).





Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 Gross Monthly + Commission.",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-10",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "TeamAce"
    
  },

Center Manager Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a Dental Care Provider, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Center Manager

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Center Manager, you will be responsible for overseeing the day-to-day operations of the dental clinic to ensure smooth workflow, excellent patient care, and compliance with regulatory standards.
	You will provide leadership, manage administrative and financial functions, and support staff to deliver high-quality service.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Oversee daily clinic operations to ensure efficient service delivery
	Manage staff schedules, performance, and patient flow for optimal care
	Monitor clinic finances, billing, and reporting to support business sustainability
	Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and maintain a professional patient experience.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or related field (Master’s preferred)
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in healthcare administration, office management, or related role
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills
	Must reside on the Island (preferred).





Salary
N250,000 - N300,000 Gross Monthly + Commission.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Administrative Officer",
  "description": "T.O.N Corporate Services&nbsp; -&nbsp;Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Administrative Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description


	The Admin Officer will provide administrative and operational support to ensure smooth day-to-day activities at TON Corporate Services.
	This role involves managing correspondence, maintaining records and ensuring efficiency in administrative processes.&nbsp;


Key Responsibilities


	? Manage company correspondence, emails, and client inquiries.
	Maintain and update digital records, files, and databases.
	Provide administrative support across TON&rsquo;s service lines.
	Track client deliverables and internal deadlines.
	Assist with HR tasks such as recruitment coordination and maintaining employee records.
	Ensure compliance with internal policies and documentation standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field.
	1-2 years of experience in a similar administrative role.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and virtual collaboration tools .
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage tasks remotely.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.


Key Competencies:


	Attention to detail
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving ability
	Time management.
	Adaptability and proactiveness

Administrative Officer Job at T.O.N Corporate Services




        
    

        
        T.O.N Corporate Services  - Our client provides businesses with a professional phone system that enables teams to manage customer calls efficiently. Their goal is to help businesses improve the quality of their customer interactions while enhancing operational efficiency.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full Time

Job Description
     

            
    




	The Admin Officer will provide administrative and operational support to ensure smooth day-to-day activities at TON Corporate Services.
	This role involves managing correspondence, maintaining records and ensuring efficiency in administrative processes. 


Key Responsibilities


	? Manage company correspondence, emails, and client inquiries.
	Maintain and update digital records, files, and databases.
	Provide administrative support across TON’s service lines.
	Track client deliverables and internal deadlines.
	Assist with HR tasks such as recruitment coordination and maintaining employee records.
	Ensure compliance with internal policies and documentation standards.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Management, or related field.
	1-2 years of experience in a similar administrative role.
	Strong organizational and multitasking skills.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and virtual collaboration tools .
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Ability to work independently and manage tasks remotely.
	High level of professionalism, discretion, and confidentiality.


Key Competencies:


	Attention to detail
	Strong interpersonal skills
	Problem-solving ability
	Time management.
	Adaptability and proactiveness
    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Website Developer (Front & Backend)",
  "description": "Clique Nigeria is an Integrated Marketing Communication Agency, Kaduna who has been in operation for more than 30 decades.&nbsp;

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job PPosition: Website Developer (Front &amp; Backend)
Job Location:&nbsp;Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	Good knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 &amp; PHP
	A good understanding of responsive design principles
	A good understanding of JavaScript, in particular jQuery
	A good understanding of the Adobe Creative Suite
	An understanding of good UX practices
	Attention to detail in converting designs into functioning frontend code
	A passion for web standards, cross browser compatibility and web speed
	Ability to write neat and well-documented code
	A willingness to learn, evaluate and improve with every project
	Good troubleshooting and debugging skills.
	Any UI &amp; UX design is a plus.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications and CV to:&nbsp;mcjworldwide@gmail.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  },

Website Developer (Front & Backend) Job at Clique Nigeria




        
    

        
        Clique Nigeria is an Integrated Marketing Communication Agency, Kaduna who has been in operation for more than 30 decades. 

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job PPosition: Website Developer (Front & Backend)
Job Location: Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	Good knowledge of HTML5, CSS3 & PHP
	A good understanding of responsive design principles
	A good understanding of JavaScript, in particular jQuery
	A good understanding of the Adobe Creative Suite
	An understanding of good UX practices
	Attention to detail in converting designs into functioning frontend code
	A passion for web standards, cross browser compatibility and web speed
	Ability to write neat and well-documented code
	A willingness to learn, evaluate and improve with every project
	Good troubleshooting and debugging skills.
	Any UI & UX design is a plus.


Salary
N80,000 - N100,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications and CV to: mcjworldwide@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
